most_active_tickets.title: Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS installation, updates, and authentication, primarily due to antivirus software falsely flagging it as malicious and potential conflicts with specific Pieces OS versions.  Suggested workarounds include adding Pieces OS to the antivirus allow list, downloading from the Microsoft Store, and waiting for a permanent fix from the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User @waseem852 reported an issue with not being able to link their Google account after updating to Pieces OS version 11.3.0 on Windows 11.
* Another user, AlexanderSLoburev, confirmed experiencing the same issue.
* The issue seems to be related to the authentication process, specifically with the URL https://authentication.pieces.services/.

**Problems Identified:**

* Google account linking fails after updating to Pieces OS 11.3.0.
* Authentication URL https://authentication.pieces.services/ is stuck in an infinite loading loop.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No solutions were explicitly proposed or implemented within the provided conversation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains open and unresolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The bot provided some helpful resources, including links to related issues, documentation, and a YouTube channel.


**This summary focuses on the most important details of the conversation, while remaining concise.**

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* SherlockSol reported an issue with Pieces not launching on their Windows PC.
* The support team requested log files and additional information about their setup.
* SherlockSol provided the requested information.
* The support team was unable to reproduce the issue and requested a video call for further troubleshooting.
* Another user, uzaxirr, reported experiencing the same issue.
* A calendar event was scheduled for a video call with uzaxirr.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces not launching on Windows PC for SherlockSol and uzaxirr.
* Difficulty reproducing the issue by the support team.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Review of log files and additional information.
* Request for a video call for further troubleshooting.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* A video call is scheduled with uzaxirr to troubleshoot the issue.
* The outcome of the video call and the resolution for SherlockSol's issue are not available in the provided conversation.

**Additional Information:**

* The provided information only covers the conversation up to April 11, 2025.
* The outcome of SherlockSol's issue is not mentioned in the conversation.
* The specific details of the video call with uzaxirr are not available.

related_issues.title: Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus
related_issues.text:
Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS_11.2.2.0_x64

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/160ed12d-f0a1-46be-bf36-05502353405e)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing issues with antivirus software (Kaspersky, Nod32, ESET) blocking or deleting Pieces OS updates and installation.
* This appears to be a false positive flag due to Pieces OS being relatively new and not widely recognized by antivirus software.
* Users are concerned about the security implications of running Pieces OS with antivirus warnings.

**Problems Identified:**

* Antivirus software falsely flagging Pieces OS as malicious.
* Users unable to update or install Pieces OS due to antivirus interference.
* User concern regarding potential security risks.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Downloading Pieces OS and Pieces for Developers directly from the Microsoft Store, where Microsoft verifies the software.
* Adding the Pieces OS executable to the antivirus allow list.
* Planning to allow users to choose where user-generated data is stored to avoid conflicts with antivirus software.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is ongoing and being actively worked on by the Pieces team.
* Users can use the proposed workarounds to access Pieces OS while the team implements a long-term solution.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue conversation spanned from March 12, 2025, to April 10, 2025. 
* The team is actively working on a solution to prevent antivirus software from flagging Pieces OS as malicious. 
* Users are encouraged to report any further issues or concerns to the Pieces support team.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Pieces OS installation and update issues:** This is the most common issue reported by users and is causing significant friction. Focus on addressing the root cause of antivirus software falsely flagging Pieces OS.

**Improve communication with users regarding antivirus conflicts:** Provide clear and concise instructions on how to whitelist Pieces OS in common antivirus software. Consider creating help articles or videos demonstrating the process.

**Investigate the authentication issue with Pieces OS 11.3.0:** This issue is preventing users from accessing their accounts and needs to be addressed urgently. Gather more data from affected users and prioritize debugging efforts.
**Monitor and address the "Invalid Port" error:** While this issue has a lower frequency, it still impacts users. Investigate the root cause and provide a solution or workaround.
**Consider allowing users to choose the installation directory for Pieces OS:** This could potentially mitigate conflicts with antivirus software and provide users with more control over their setup.
**Continue to engage with users experiencing issues:** Respond to support tickets promptly and provide regular updates on the progress of bug fixes and improvements.
